title: Looking for good, in-print lettering books
content:
Are there any good, in-print books on non-calligraphic lettering? I have no trouble finding books about formal calligraphy, but when I look for books on hand lettering what I find are books about arts-and-crafts projects. Is this the sort of thing that I just have to look for on eBay?

Edit: I already have all of Leslie Cabarga’s pertinent work.
author: blank

comments.content: You'll find differing opinions but I like [Designing Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020045643/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designing%20Type)

I’ll try the Speedball book—I didn’t realize that it was still in print—for some reason Utrecht art supplies seems to be the only retailer with new copies.

I have Designing Type...but it’s not really a hand-lettering book.

Hmmm, I have these two at hand right now:

[_Lettering Design -- Form & Skill in the Design & Use of Letters_](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020045643/http:/www.amazon.com/Creative-Lettering-Calligraphy-Michael-Harvey/dp/0713645768/ref=sr_1_7/105-6723560-8082023?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1181452725&sr=1-7), by Michael Harvey

[_Creative Lettering Today_](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020045643/http:/www.amazon.com/Creative-Lettering-Today-Michael-Harvey/dp/1558214534/ref=sr_oe_35_1/105-6723560-8082023?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1181453361&sr=1-35), also by Michael Harvey

I have some others, but right now they are buried inside a few boxes outside my bedroom... :-/
